content.rendered:
Samsung released a new handset this month, the Galaxy Note 9.  It is a cracking handset but has come with a hefty price tag. So, before rushing out to upgrade why not have a look at the Galaxy Note 8.  What happens when a manufacturer releases a new handset is the price on its predecessor drops, and in this case, this puts the Galaxy Note 8 right in the middle of the frame as a total bargain as prices will now be reduced.

For Business or Pleasure

One of the selling points of the Galaxy Note series is the ability to use these phones on the go, being widely touted as good enough to leave your laptop at home.  It is fair to say they have a lot of functionality that would undoubtedly make running a business on the move a lot easier and the Galaxy Note 8 comes with the S-Pen which makes input much more comfortable than trying to manipulate the screen, particularly if you have larger hands.

Because Samsung includes a micro SD card space in their phones you also have a significant amount of memory on offer, so you can store documents, invoices, quotes and more if you are out and about with customers all day.

This means you can always have everything you need on hand. Now, if you prefer to be a social user this large storage space is also great for music and video, so do not be put off if you do not have a business, this is a feature packed robust handset that will now be dropping in price, giving you the opportunity to bag a substantial mobile phone contract bargain.

Power and Beauty

The Galaxy Note S9 runs on Exynos 8896 which makes it a powerful handset and it comes with 64GB of memory and an expansion slot of up to 256GB meaning you can never really run out of space.  It offers an excellent battery life and has the option of super fast and wireless charging, although you will need to get the wireless charger as it doesn’t come with the phone.

The handset is tall and sleek which is another reason that the S-Pen comes in useful but the overall finish is appealing.  The glass screen display is AMOLED and offers 1440×2960 resolution.

It addressed the complaints that the balance of colour was a little off and showcases clarity and perfection for an excellent viewing performance whether you are using apps or streaming film. If you are looking to stream music you will be delighted to hear that the sound quality is also first-rate, so enjoy!

Whatever you intend to use your Galaxy Note 8 for, you can be sure that you are getting the handset on the best possible mobile phone deal as prices are better than they have ever have been.  Be sure to check out the wide variety of deals on offer from both EE and Vodafone; we have been handpicking them for our customers because we like to offer a wide range of choice.

excerpt.rendered: Samsung released a new handset this month, the Galaxy Note 9. It is a cracking handset but has come with a hefty price tag.
